titleInfo.title: Second New Orleans District, Corps of Engineers, U.S. Army, asphalt mattress sinking operations at Westwego Ferry Landing, La., Mississippi River, 1938 November 8.

mods.note: Caption title. Asphalt mattress sinking operations at Westwego Ferry Landing, directly across the Mississippi River from the foot of Walnut Street, New Orleans, La. Gap was made in mat for fitting the landward section around ferry landing pile structure. Beginning the asphalt pour. Government plant and hired labor."No.2554."

titleInfo.partName: I. Engineering and Levee Revetment documents, ca. 1925-1959
I. Photographs of levee work, ca. 1928-1945

titleInfo.title: William Barth Photographs of Mississippi River and Atchafalaya River operations
